title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{f{\left(x_1\right)}-f{\left(x_2\right)}}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$x+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and x for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression $$\frac{{3\left(x+h\right)}^2-2-3x^2-2}{x+h-x}$$.

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the expression $$\frac{{3\left(x+h\right)}^2-2-3x^2-2}{x+h-x}$$. What do you get?
